channel.title: Laserium on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Laserium on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: Frickin' Laser Beams
item.description: Today in Tedium: When the Beatles took their earliest U.S. tours, the limitations of the concert infrastructure at the time showed themselves in a big way. Put simply, you couldn’t actually hear the band over the screaming teenagers—a problem so difficult to solve that it took 40 years for technology to advance to the point where it made their only official live album, released in 1977, listenable. Eventually, this led to the creation of better sound systems for all the bands that came after them.
